elements.title: ashy flycatcher (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that one way to tell the African dusky flycatcher apart from the ashy flycatcher (example pictured) is that the former is "cuter"?

elements.title: Kishvari (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that scholarly study of the poetry of Kishvari, one of the most important Azerbaijani poets of the 15th and 16th centuries, only started in 1928?

elements.title: George S. Bowdoin Stable (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the George S. Bowdoin Stable has variously served as a garage, private residence, art gallery, cultural center, and office?

elements.title: Liz O'Riordan (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that in 2018, breast surgeon Liz O'Riordan arrived for her breast cancer treatment dressed as Mrs Incredible?

elements.title: season three of Last Week Tonight with John Oliver (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that in season three of Last Week Tonight with John Oliver, Oliver personally forgave nearly $15 million of medical debt for 9,000 Americans?

elements.title: Science-Fiction: The Gernsback Years (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that E. F. Bleiler conducted research for Science-Fiction: The Gernsback Years by reading all 1,835 stories published in science fiction magazines between 1926 and 1936?

elements.title: a fictional player (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Buffalo Sabres drafted a fictional player in the 1974 National Hockey League Amateur Draft?

elements.title: Atlantic Avenue–Barclays Center station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Atlantic Avenue–Barclays Center station has a Hook, Line, and Sinker?
